result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Zoey M Pollard

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Zoey Monique Pollard Jr in court.  Attorney John Mathew Krejci in court for Zoey Monique Pollard Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah Dahdouh in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant needs to contact SPD to get Attorney Krejci appointed. Case is adjourned in Branch 30.
Status conference scheduled for November 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 10/12/22. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Zoey M Pollard in court.  Attorney Samuel Tabin in court for State of Wisconsin. Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued. Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30. Criminal complaint read aloud in open court at request of defendant. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 30.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with ANS, BAM. Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Zoey M Pollard not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. Court makes a finding that there is a possible victim identified and stays the forfeiture order with restitution to be determined at close of case.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 9/28/22 @ 1:30p
